get.summary: Search for objects in the IGVF Project
get.description: Search endpoint that accepts various query parameters to filter and format results. Supports complex filtering on types and fields within JSON objects.

parameters.name: datastore
parameters.description: Specifies the datastore to search in.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Enables debug mode for the search.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Fields to include in the response. Can be repeated for multiple fields.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format. Use 'json' for machine-readable response.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the returned objects.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Use 'all' for all results.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Fields to sort results by. Prefix with '-' for descending order. Can be repeated for multiple sort fields.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of objects to return. Can be repeated for multiple types.

parameters.name: advancedQuery
parameters.description: Advanced query string for complex searches.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: General search term that can return multiple object types.

parameters.name: field_filters
parameters.description: Any field from any object type can be used as a filter. Use '!=' for negation, '*' as a wildcard, and 'lt:', 'lte:', 'gt:', 'gte:' for range queries on numeric fields.

examples.description: Search for experiments, sort by multiple fields, and specify multiple types

anyOf.comment: Content Type describes the content of the file.
Content Type describes the content of the file.
Content Type describes the content of the file.

Content Type describes the content of the file. Genome reference are composite nucleic acid sequences assembled from the sequence of several different individual organisms representing the species. Guide RNA sequences are sequences of RNA molecules used in assays involving CRISPR editing. Sequence barcodes are lists of barcodes found in the sequencing library. Spike-ins are nucleic acid fragments of known sequence and quantity used for calibration in high-throughput sequencing. Transcriptome references are transcriptomic sequences of an idealized representative individual in a species. Vector sequences are sequences tested in MPRAs.

Content Type describes the content of the file. Reads are individual sequences of bases corresponding to DNA or RNA fragments in a FASTQ text file format. Subreads are sequences of bases produced using PacBio platforms.
Content Type describes the content of the file.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The type of content in the file.
content_type.comment: Content Type describes the content of the file. Genome reference are composite nucleic acid sequences assembled from the sequence of several different individual organisms representing the species. Guide RNA sequences are sequences of RNA molecules used in assays involving CRISPR editing. Sequence barcodes are lists of barcodes found in the sequencing library. Spike-ins are nucleic acid fragments of known sequence and quantity used for calibration in high-throughput sequencing. Transcriptome references are transcriptomic sequences of an idealized representative individual in a species. Vector sequences are sequences tested in MPRAs.

file_set_type.title: File Set Type
file_set_type.description: The type or category of this construct library set.
file_set_type.comment: File set type describes the content of the construct library set. Guide libraries are guides used for CRISPR screens. Reporter libraries are reporters used for MPRA. Expression vector libraries are used when the content of the vector (a specific gene, exon, or tile of a protein) will be expressed in the target cells.

scope.title: Library Construct Scope
scope.description: The scope or scale that this construct library is designed to target. If the scope is across gene(s) or loci, these will need to be specified in the genes or loci property. If exon is specified, an exon identifier and the associated gene will need to be listed in exon and genes properties. If tile is specified, a tile identifier, start and stop coordinates, and the associated gene will need to be listed in tile and small_scale_gene_list or large_scale_gene_list properties.

selection_criteria.title: Selection Criteria
selection_criteria.description: The criteria used to select the sequence material cloned into the library.

items.title: Selection Criterion
items.description: The criterion used to select or design the sequence material cloned into the library.
items.comment: A construct library of phenotype-associated variants must list at least one disease or phenotype in the associated_phenotypes property.

integrated_content_files.title: Integrated Content Files
integrated_content_files.description: The files containing sequence material of interest either used for insert design or directly cloned into vectors in this library.

items.title: Integrated Content File
items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

associated_phenotypes.title: Associated Phenotypes
associated_phenotypes.description: Ontological terms for diseases or phenotypes associated with the sequence material cloned in this construct library.

items.title: Associated Phenotype
items.comment: See phenotype_term.json for a list of available identifiers.

orf_list.title: List of Open Reading Frames (ORF)
orf_list.description: List of Open Reading Frame this construct library was designed to target.

items.title: List of Open Reading Frames (ORF).
items.description: List of Open Reading Frame this construct library was designed to target.

exon.title: Exon
exon.description: An identifier in plain text for the specific exon in an expression vector library. The associated gene must be listed in the small_scale_gene_list property.

tile.title: Tile
tile.description: The coordinates and an identifier in plain text for the specific tile of a protein region cloned in an expression vector library. The associated gene for this protein must be listed in the small_scale_gene_list or large_scale_gene_list property.
tile.comment: The protein tile locus is defined using 1-based numbering where 1 indicates the N-terminal Methionine initiator.

tile_id.title: Tile ID
tile_id.description: An identifier in plain text for the specific tile of a protein region cloned in an expression vector library.

guide_type.title: Guide Type
guide_type.description: The design of guides used in a CRISPR library, paired-guide (pgRNA) or single-guide (sgRNA).

tiling_modality.title: Tiling Modality
tiling_modality.description: The tiling modality of guides across elements or loci in a CRISPR library.
tiling_modality.comment: Peak tiling = all possible gRNA in a selection of peaks. Full tiling = all possible gRNA across an entire locus, including regulatory elements and non regulatory elements. Sparse peaks = a small set of gRNA against a selection of peaks.

average_guide_coverage.title: Average Guide Coverage
average_guide_coverage.description: The average number of guides targeting each element of interest in the library.

lower_bound_guide_coverage.title: Lower Bound Guide Coverage
lower_bound_guide_coverage.description: Lower bound of the number of guides targeting each element of interest in the library.

upper_bound_guide_coverage.title: Upper Bound Guide Coverage
upper_bound_guide_coverage.description: Upper bound of the number of guides targeting each element of interest in the library.

average_insert_size.title: Average Insert Size

data_use_limitation.title: Data Use Limitation
data_use_limitation.description: Code indicating the limitations on data use for data generated from the applicable samples. GRU (General research use): Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the Data Use Certification: these data will be added to the dbGaP Collection. HMB (Health/medical/biomedical): Use of the data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. DS (Disease specific): Use of the data must be related to the specified disease. Other: any other customized limitation.

data_use_limitation_modifiers.title: Data Use Limitation Modifiers
data_use_limitation_modifiers.description: Code indicating a modifier on the limitations on data use for data generated from the applicable samples. COL: Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). GSO: Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only. IRB: Approval Required IRB Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. MDS: Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development and testing of software or algorithms). NPU: Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. PUB: Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

submissionExample.appscript: The EN-TEx resource of multi-tissue personal epigenomes & variant-impact models
submissionExample.igvf_utils: The EN-TEx resource of multi-tissue personal epigenomes & variant-impact models

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.description: Abstract of the publication or communication.

submissionExample.appscript: Understanding how genetic variants impact molecular phenotypes is a key goal of functional genomics, currently hindered by reliance on a single haploid reference genome. Here, we present the EN-TEx resource of personal epigenomes, for ∼25 tissues and >10 assays in four donors (>1500 open-access functional genomic and proteomic datasets, in total). Each dataset is mapped to a matched, diploid personal genome, which has long-read phasing and structural variants.
submissionExample.igvf_utils: Understanding how genetic variants impact molecular phenotypes is a key goal of functional genomics, currently hindered by reliance on a single haploid reference genome. Here, we present the EN-TEx resource of personal epigenomes, for ∼25 tissues and >10 assays in four donors (>1500 open-access functional genomic and proteomic datasets, in total). Each dataset is mapped to a matched, diploid personal genome, which has long-read phasing and structural variants.

submissionExample.appscript: Joel Rozowsky, Jiahao Gao, Beatrice Borsari, et al.
submissionExample.igvf_utils: Joel Rozowsky, Jiahao Gao, Beatrice Borsari, et al.

virtual.title: Virtual
virtual.description: Virtual samples are not representing actual physical entities from experiments, but rather capturing metadata about hypothetical samples that the reported analysis results are relevant for.
virtual.comment: For example, a prediction of a certain TF's binding profile in HepG2 cells should not be associated with an actual batch of HepG2 cells, but with a virtual sample of HepG2 cells, making it clear that the reported prediction is not directly associated with an actual HepG2 sample in a specific lab and experiment.

moi.description: The actual multiplicity of infection (MOI) for vectors introduced to this sample. At least one construct library set must be specified in order to specify MOI. This property should capture the actual MOI, and not the targeted MOI.
moi.comment: Use of this property requires construct_library_sets.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Specific quantity of the applied treatment (used in conjunction with amount_units).

amount_units.title: Amount Units
amount_units.description: A unit for an amount other than those for time or temperature.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration indicates the time elapsed between the start and end of the treatment.

pH.title: pH
pH.description: Final pH of the solution containing a chemical compound (if applicable)

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: The intended purpose for treating the samples; Activation: treatment is known to activate a pathway in the biosample; Agonist: a substance which is known to initiate a physiological response when combined with a receptor; Antagonist: a substance that is known to interfere with or inhibits the physiological action of another; Control: treatment applied to a sample for control purposes; Differentiation: treatment that is applied to convert a less specialized cell to a more specialized cell; De-differentiation: treatment used to reprogram differentiated cells back to less determined cell states; Perturbation: treatment applied to the sample in order to study the effect of its application; Selection: treatment used to affect biosample in a way that can be used to distinguish cells and select for in the downstream steps; Stimulation: treatment applied to stimulate a cellular pathway.

post_treatment_time.title: Post-treatment Time
post_treatment_time.description: Post treatment time in conjunction with post treatment time units is used to specify the time that has passed between the point when biosamples were removed from the treatment solution before being sampled or treated with the next treatment.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: The temperature in Celsius to which the sample was exposed

treatment_type.title: Treatment Type
treatment_type.description: The classification of treatment agent that specifies its exact molecular nature. Chemical type refers to (natural or synthetic) organic/inorganic compounds and also includes drugs, while protein type is restricted to active protein biomolecules that are naturally or artifically synthesized via cellular translation mechanism of converting DNA into a protein. Environmental type referes to other external conditions that directly influence biological processes or reactions within a given environment. Example of chemical type: lactate, ethanol,hydrocortisone, LPS etc. Example of protein type: Interferons, interlukin, antibodies, etc. Example of chemical type: stiffness.

treatment_term_id.title: Treatment Term ID
treatment_term_id.description: Ontology identifier describing a component in the treatment.
treatment_term_id.comment: For chemical type treatments, CHEBI ids are required while UniProt ids are used for protein type.

treatment_term_name.title: Treatment Term Name
treatment_term_name.description: Ontology term describing a component in the treatment that is the principal component affecting the biosample being treated. Examples: interferon gamma, interleukin-4, Fibroblast growth factor 2, 20-hydroxyecdysone, 5-bromouridine etc.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.

schema_version.title: Schema Version
schema_version.description: The version of the JSON schema that the server uses to validate the object.
schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.

notes.title: Notes
notes.comment: Do not submit. A place for the DACC to keep information that does not have a place in the schema.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: Lab specific identifiers to reference an object.
aliases.comment: The purpose of this field is to provide a link into the lab LIMS and to facilitate shared objects.

items.title: Lab Alias
items.description: A lab specific identifier to reference an object.
items.comment: Current convention is colon separated lab name and lab identifier. (e.g. john-doe:42).

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description: The date the object was created.
creation_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.

submitted_by.title: Submitted By
submitted_by.description: The user who submitted the object.
submitted_by.comment: Do not submit. The user that created the object is assigned by the server.

submitter_comment.title: Submitter Comment
submitter_comment.description: Additional information specified by the submitter to be displayed as a comment on the portal.

description.title: Description
description.description: A plain text description of the object.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email associated with the user's account.

lab.title: Lab
lab.description: Lab user is primarily associated with.
lab.comment: See lab.json for available identifiers.

submits_for.title: Submits For
submits_for.description: Labs user is authorized to submit data for.

items.title: Lab Submittable For
items.description: A lab user is authorized to submit for.
items.comment: See lab.json for available identifiers.

viewing_groups.title: View Access Groups
viewing_groups.description: The group that determines which set of data the user has permission to view.

job_title.title: Job Title
job_title.description: The role of the user in their lab or organization.

title.title: Title
title.description: The full name of the user.

release_timestamp.title: Release Timestamp
release_timestamp.description: The date the object was released.
release_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is released is assigned by the server.

publication_identifiers.title: Publication Identifiers
publication_identifiers.description: The publication identifiers that provide more information about the object.

items.title: Publication Identifier
items.description: A publication identifier that provides more information about the object.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents that provide additional information (not data file).

items.title: Document
items.description: A document that provides additional information (not data file).
items.comment: See document.json for available identifiers.

lab.title: Lab
lab.comment: Required. See lab.json for list of available identifiers.

award.title: Award
award.comment: Required. See award.json for list of available identifiers.

accession.title: Accession
accession.description: A unique identifier to be used to reference the object prefixed with IGVF.
accession.comment: Do not submit. The accession is assigned by the server.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate Accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

collections.title: Collections
collections.description: Some samples are part of particular data collections.
collections.comment: Do not submit. Collections are for DACC use only.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of metadata submission.

revoke_detail.title: Revoke Detail
revoke_detail.description: Explanation of why an object was transitioned to the revoked status.
revoke_detail.comment: Do not submit. This is set by admins when an object is revoked.
